Detailed Description

GPL v2

Authors: Martijn Brekhof <m.brekhof@gmail.com>

Format of the callback function should be: functionname( GtkWidget *widget, GdkEvent *event, void *data ). Where *data will be the data you passed on to gm_create_empty_button in *data.

Function Documentation

gboolean check_key ( GdkEvent *  event  ) 

checks if spacebar or mousebutton was pressed to generate the event

Parameters:
event pointer to the GdkEvent that was generated
Returns:
TRUE if spacebar or mousebutton generated the event. FALSE otherwise

int gm_calculate_box_length ( int  total_length,
struct length *  box_length 
)

function to calculate the absolute width based upon the total available width

Parameters:
total_length Total available width for the box element
*box_length Pointer to a struct length holding the length value and type of the box
Returns:
box width in amount of pixels

GtkWidget* gm_create_button ( menu_elements *  elt,
int  max_width,
int  max_height,
void(*)(GtkWidget *, GdkEvent *, menu_elements *)  processevent 
)

Create a single button possibly with a label.

Parameters:
elt pointer to menu_element struct that contains the logo image filename.
max_width button width
max_height button height
processevent callback function that will be called when button is pressed
Returns:
GtkWidget pointer to the new button

GtkWidget* gm_create_buttonbox ( menu_elements *  elts,
void(*)(GtkWidget *, GdkEvent *, menu_elements *)  processevent,
gboolean  calc_fontsize 
)

Create the button layout using the available screen height and width.

Parameters:
elts pointer to first menu_elements structure
processevent function pointer to function which should be used as callback when a button is pressed.
calc_fontsize boolean if true will recalculate fontsize, if false it will take the current fontsize.
Returns:
GtkWidget pointer to a vbox

GtkWidget* gm_create_empty_button ( void *  callbackfunc,
void *  data 
)

Create a single empty button.

Parameters:
callbackfunc callback function that will be called when button is pressed.
data data to be parsed as argument when calling callbackfunc
Returns:
GtkWidget pointer to the new button

void *  callbackfunc,
void *  data 
)

creates a basic cancel button

Parameters:
buttontext string that should be used as label
callbackfunc void pointer to callback function that should be called when button is clicked
data void pointer to arguments that should be passed to callback function
Returns:
GtkWidget pointer to the new button

Creates the panel layout using the available screen height and width.

GtkWidget pointer to container holding the panel

GtkWidget* gm_load_image ( const char *  elt_name,
const char *  elt_logo,
const char *  cacheloc,
const char *  programname,
int  max_width,
int  max_height 
)

loads image and scales it making sure the image fits inside max_width*max_height maintaining the correct aspect ratio

Parameters:
elt_name name of the element
elt_logo filename of the logo image to load
cacheloc directory where the cached images are kept
programname name of the main program that calls this function (i.e. gappman, netman, etc.)
max_width maximum width image may have
max_height maximum height image may have
Returns:
GtkWidget pointer to image

)

quits program only if mousebutton or spacebar is pressed

dummy widget that emitted event
event event signal that triggered the function

sets the generic fontsize for gappman

Parameters:

sets the screen size that should be used by gappman

Parameters:

void gm_show_confirmation_dialog ( const gchar *  message,
const gchar *  msg_button1,
void *  callback1,
void *  data1,
const gchar *  msg_button2,
void *  callback2,
void *  data2,
GtkWidget *  mainwin 
)

shows a question dialog with regards to gappman fontsize.

Parameters:
message pointer to char that will hold the general question
msg_button1 pointer to char that will hold the message for the first button.
callback1 callback function that should be called when the first button is pressed. Use NULL to disable using a callbackfunction for the first button
msg_button2 pointer to char that will hold the message for the second button.
data1 void pointer pointing to any data that should be passed as an argument when calling the callbackfunction callback1
callback2 callback function that should be called when the second button is pressed. Use NULL to disable using a callbackfunction for the second button
data2 void pointer pointing to any data that should be passed as an argument when calling the callbackfunction callback2
mainwin pointer to parent window GtkWidget that called gm_show_confirmation_dialog. If NULL dialog is positioned in the center.

void gm_show_error_dialog ( const gchar *  message,
GtkWidget *  mainwin,
void *  callback 
)

shows an error dialog with regards to gappman fontsize.

Parameters:
message pointer to char that will hold the message
mainwin pointer to parent window GtkWidget that called gm_show_error_dialog. If NULL dialog is positioned in the center.
callback pointer to callback function that should be called when Close button is pressed. If NULL the default action will be taken which simply destroys this error dialog.
